hackathon-eligibility: LA Hacks focuses primarily on undergraduate and graduate students but accepts high school students and recent grads (1-2 years out) on a case-by-case basis. Dropouts who would otherwise currently be in college are cool too.
hackathon-rules:
- YOU MUST BE AT LA HACKS TO WORK ON A PROJECT FOR SUBMISSION
- You cannot work on your project before hacking begins (which is officially 11:00pm PT on Friday, April 3rd) 
- You cannot steal another team's source code
- The decision of judges is final for determining prizes and awards
- Please comply with all instructions from LA Hacks organizers

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The first team gets $5000 as the prize sponsored by Snapchat
The team will get a budget of $2000 to order absolutely anything they want from anywhere!
The team will get a budget of $2000 to order absolutely anything they want from anywhere!
The hack with the best overall design, meaning a beautiful UI and a flowing intuitive UX will win the prize for "Best Design Hack!"
The hack which takes the society we live in, into consideration and comes up with something which makes our community a better place to live in will win the prize for “Best Civic Hack!"
Music is a unique way to express ourselves. The hack which best uses the element of music in a unique way will win the prize for “Best Music Hack!"
To be announced!
Moxtra will be awarding $1000 to the Winning team of Moxtra's API/SDK Best Collaboration Hack.
Grand Prize: 4 x Surface Pro 3
1 Nest Thermostat, Nest Protect, or Dropcam Pro to every member in the winning team
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Thoughtful Use of the Nest API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: WICED™ Sense Development Kits to each member
50” Samsung 4K UHDTV
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most innovative use of DIRECTV API

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Raspberry Pi 2 for each team member
$400 Hacker's Choice Prize
4 SmartThings kits
An award letter provides a 1 year access to the Wolfram Programming Cloud for top 3 teams.
1 Tessel+ 1 Module per team member
4 Pebble Steels
Parrot drones for each team member for best use of our API

The KPCB Fellows Challenge is a set of open innovation challenges that aim to get hackers to hack for good. Build for good on one of the KPCB fellows challenges and winners get $1k and a finalist spot in the 2016 Fellows application cycle. The challenges can be found at
Prize: up to (3) Beats Studio Headphones
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Use of Intel Technology (using Intel Edison and/or Intel XDK and/or Intel Mashery API Network)

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The HeyWatch API enables from uploading and simply encoding from one video format to another one, to generating multiple output files for several platforms (mobile, web, …) and generating exclusive thumbnails such as storyboard or animated GIFs. So sky’s the limit :)
Kander will be sponsoring $400 in Visa gift cards to the best iOS app!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best IOS APP sponsored by Kander

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 4 of Holy Stone Mini RC Drone with 720p HD Camera 6-Axis Gyro 2.4 GHz and 4 of Arduino UNO R3 board with DIP ATmega328P

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
How unique was the idea behind the hack? 
How technically challenging is the hack?
How good was the implementation?
